title: 13 Best Bar Carts to Elevate Your Entertaining Game (2025)
description: Happy hour is best served on wheels
author: Yelena Moroz Alpert
excerpt: Looking for the best bar carts? Take your home bar to the next level with these top-shelf finds. Discover bar and serving carts fit for every aesthetic.

In fact, the predecessor of the bar cart was once a Victorian-era tea trolley. Only when the Prohibition hit did these side tables on wheels find their true calling. Many, many iterations later—from Alvar Aalto’s iconic tea trolley, which has inspired many picks on this list, to USM’s blessedly minimalist spin on the genre—the beauty of this booze trolley remains that it can completely transform a room or give a useless nook some purpose. Though they’ve fallen out of favor in many modern homes, these rolling wonders make an elegant—and functional—home base for all your mixology essentials, from stemware and decanters to liquor bottles and mixers. They also don’t have to be used to haul booze at all, instead doubling as portable storage for crafts, books, beauty or bathroom supplies, and houseplants.Employed outside, a stylish bar cart can give a dinner party some polish or emulate a poolside butler. html:
Featured in this article

The best bar carts are not just for someone who likes to host a cocktail soirée. In fact, the predecessor of the bar cart was once a Victorian-era tea trolley. Only when the Prohibition hit did these side tables on wheels find their true calling. Many, many iterations later—from Alvar Aalto’s iconic tea trolley, which has inspired many picks on this list, to USM’s blessedly minimalist spin on the genre—the beauty of this booze trolley remains that it can completely transform a room or give a useless nook some purpose. Though they’ve fallen out of favor in many modern homes, these rolling wonders make an elegant—and functional—home base for all your mixology essentials, from stemware and decanters to liquor bottles and mixers. They also don’t have to be used to haul booze at all, instead doubling as portable storage for crafts, books, beauty or bathroom supplies, and houseplants.

Employed outside, a stylish bar cart can give a dinner party some polish or emulate a poolside butler. Load it up with a pitcher of lemonade and a basket of sunscreen on top, and extra towels on the bottom and you’ll never have to leave your lounge.

Best Bar Cart For Industrial Style

Burrow Dram Bar Cart

  • Material: Plywood and steel frame
  • Dimensions: 27.75" L x 18" W x 31.5" H
  • Weight: N/A
  • Weight capacity: 200 pounds
  • Assembly required: Yes

Furniture maker Burrow is better known for their seating, but also makes utility carts for happy hour. The cartoonishly large wheels are a nod to Alvar Aalto’s tea trolley, while the contrasting bent plywood shelves—in oak or walnut colorways—and black-rim wheels continue the retro-leaning design. Best of all, this cart doesn’t require any tools for assembly.

Best Bar Cart For Midcentury Design

Article Cotu Bar Cart

  • Material: Solid and veneered American black walnut, brass on handles and castor wheels
  • Dimensions: 30.5"H x 17.5"W x 29"D
  • Weight: 27 pounds
  • Weight Capacity: N/A
  • Assembly required: Yes

Made of solid and veneered walnut with elegant brass details, the Cotu (from the makers of our favorite bar cabinets) is a delightful midcentury-style bar cart that has a distinctive asymmetrical incline on each shelf. Use the wider edge for housing smaller utensils and glasses, while leaving the shallower end for larger bottles that are less likely to topple over the edge.

Best Bar Cart For Outdoors

Business & Pleasure Co. Al Fresco Bar Cart

  • Material: Steel
  • Dimensions: 39"W x 20"D x 36"H
  • Weight: 48 pounds
  • Weight capacity: 200 pounds
  • Assembly required: No, ships via white glove delivery

Business & Pleasure Co.’s Al Fresco bar cart is a throwback to a time of leisure under the Parisian sun. While the cart can be used indoors, we can’t imagine a better place for it than on a terrace surrounded by a garden. As if the charming scalloped trim wasn’t enough, the designated umbrella hole nails the summery vibe for poolside mojitos or curbside lemonade stands.

Best Bar Cart For Fluted Detail

Anthropologie Norma Fluted Oak Bar Cart

  • Material: Oak wood and brass trim
  • Dimensions: 30"H x 26.5"W x 20"D
  • Weight: 33 pounds
  • Weight capacity: N/A
  • Assembly required: No

Fluting is something we’ve been seeing a lot of lately and the Anthropologie Norma oak bar cart confirms that the grooved lines are not going anywhere. The brass accents on the side handles and casters only add to the classic silhouette. One thing to keep in mind is that at 30 inches high it is somewhat on the shorter side and may not be ideal if you’re tall.

Best Vintage-Style Bar Cart

Greenrow Liona Twisted Bar Cart

  • Material: Solid, kiln-dried rubberwood with oak veneer
  • Dimensions: 29"W x 17"D x 32"H
  • Weight: N/A
  • Weight capacity: N/A
  • Assembly required: No

To find that heirloom quality of Victorian design lore, look no further than Greenrow’s Liona bar cart with Barley twist legs to charm you an dyour guests. The two shelves in a chestnut finish offer ample space for glassware and a floral arrangement, should you want to create a whole spread for summer spritzers.

Best Bar Cart for Coastal Casual

West Elm Rounded Wood Bar Cart

  • Material: Hand-wrapped rattan frame over mahogany wood, tempered glass shelves
  • Dimensions: 33"W x 14"D x 33.5"H
  • Weight: 23 pounds
  • Weight Capacity: 80 pounds
  • Assembly required: No, white glove delivery service

This pick will look stunning in any space, but especially one that prizes Palm Beach Regency touches. Three levels make it easy to style, whether you’re packing it full of bottles or prefer a more curated approach to bar cart decor. The frame is made from hand-wrapped rattan over mahogany FSC-Certified wood and finished with tempered glass shelving.

USM Haller Bar Cart

  • Material: Metal, glass
  • Dimensions: 19"D x 28"W x 34"H
  • Weight: 24 pounds
  • Weight Capacity: 66 pounds
  • Assembly required: Yes

This sleek, minimalist bar cart will stay with you for many moves. The chrome steel frame defines the iconic silhouette, and you can choose from nine powder-coated steel panels that come in classic black and white, as well as ultra-bold yellow and emerald.

AllModern Cullin Metal Bar Cart

  • Material: Glass top and iron frame
  • Dimensions: 30''H x 35.8''W x 18.6''D
  • Weight: 30 pounds
  • Weight capacity: 11 pounds
  • Assembly required: Yes

For Bauhaus style on a budget, the Cullin bar cart is more than ready to serve. The angular silhouette resembles less of a cart and more of a full on booze-fueled vehicle, and feels especially cheerful in green or brick red colorways (white and black are also available). With storage for four wine bottles, you can stock multiple kinds of sippers, from sparkling to organic, to please even the snobbiest of guests.

McGee & Co. Haviland Bar Cart

  • Material: Aluminum frame and all-weather resin wicker
  • Dimensions: 24" Dia. x 30"H
  • Weight: N/A
  • Weight capacity: N/A
  • Assembly required: No

The woven all-weather wicker trays of the McGee & Co. Haviland bar cart resemble a side table, with basket surfaces that could just as easily store fruit as a pitcher of iced tea. Wheel it onto a veranda or sunroom to draw in some sustenance on wheels.

Nathan James Sally Rolling Bar

  • Material: Metal, glass
  • Dimensions: 19"D x 28"W x 34"H
  • Weight: 24 pounds
  • Weight Capacity: 66 pounds
  • Assembly required: Yes

For an option that blends into its surroundings, consider this two-tier industrial bar cart with tempered glass shelves and locking casters. The crisp lines make this an ideal addition to a minimalist space. Add a mirror or abstract art piece above for a curated look.

West Elm Midcentury Bar Cart

  • Material: Kiln-dried solid eucalyptus wood and engineered wood with an acacia wood veneer; antique brass-finished rails and casters.
  • Dimensions: 32.4"W x 19.9"D x 32"H
  • Weight: 75 pounds
  • Weight Capacity: N/A
  • Assembly required: Yes, minimal

Sturdy and sustainably sourced, this midcentury beauty from West Elm is made in a Fair Trade facility from FSC-certified kiln-dried eucalyptus wood. The soft honey finish of acacia veneer gives this piece accessibility, while the antique brass details add a touch of flair.

Linon Gina Mid-Century Bar Cart

  • Material: Metal
  • Dimensions: 17.38"D x 30"W x 31.75"H
  • Weight: 30 pounds
  • Weight Capacity: N/A
  • Assembly required: Yes

Arrange your glassware, cocktail shakers, and bar tools the gilded Art Deco way with this wavy bar cart. The pretty Old Hollywood pick feels like something right out of a Gatsby party.

Sauder Coral Cape Serving Bar Cart

  • Material: Metal, glass
  • Dimensions: 19"D x 28"W x 34"H
  • Weight: 24 pounds
  • Weight Capacity: 66 pounds
  • Assembly required: Yes

The soft, curvy lines of this three-tier metal-and-glass bar cart would look especially fetching paired with pastel-hued glassware or perhaps something midcentury with gilded details to contrast the amber-tinted shelves.
